name: NUnit
help: NUnit is a unit-testing framework for all .Net languages. Initially ported from JUnit, the current production release, version 3.0, has been completely rewritten with many new features and support for a wide range of .NET platforms.

properties.name: InputFiles
properties.help:
The console program must always have an assembly or project specified. Assemblies are specified by file name or path, which may be absolute or relative. Relative paths are interpreted based on the current directory.

In addition to assemblies, you may specify any project type that is understood by NUnit. Out of the box, this includes various Visual Studio project types as well as NUnit (.nunit) test projects (see NUnit Test Projects for a description of NUnit test projects).

If the NUnit V2 framework driver is installed, test assemblies may be run based on any version of the NUnit framework beginning with 2.0. Without the V2 driver, only version 3.0 and higher tests may be run.

properties.name: Tests
properties.help: Comma-separated list of names of tests to run or explore. This option may be repeated. Note that this option is retained for backward compatibility. The --where option can now be used instead.

properties.name: TestListFile
properties.help: The name (or path) of a file containing a list of tests to run or explore, one per line.

properties.name: WhereExpression
properties.help: An expression indicating which tests to run. It may specify test names, classes, methods, catgories or properties comparing them to actual values with the operators <c>==</c>, <c>!=</c>, <c>=~</c> and <c>!~</c>. See Test Selection Language for a full description of the syntax.

properties.name: Parameters
properties.help: A test parameter specified in the form NAME=VALUE. Multiple parameters may be specified, separated by semicolons or by repeating the <c>--params</c> option multiple times.

properties.name: Configuration
properties.help: Name of a project configuration to load (e.g.: <c>Debug</c>).

properties.name: Process
properties.help: Process isolation for test assemblies. Values: <c>Single</c>, <c>Separate</c>, <c>Multiple</c>. If not specified, defaults to Separate for a single assembly or Multiple for more than one. By default, processes are run in parallel.

properties.name: InProcess
properties.help: This option is a synonym for <c>--process=Single</c>

properties.name: Agents
properties.help: Number of agents that may be allowed to run simultaneously assuming you are not running inprocess. If not specified, all agent processes run tests at the same time, whatever the number of assemblies. This setting is used to control running your assemblies in parallel.

properties.name: Domain
properties.help: Domain isolation for test assemblies. Values: <c>None</c>, <c>Single</c>, <c>Multiple</c>. If not specified, defaults to <c>Single</c> for a single assembly or <c>Multiple</c> for more than one.

properties.name: Framework
properties.help: Framework type/version to use for tests. Examples: <c>mono</c>, <c>net-4.5,</c> <c>v4.0</c>, <c>2.0</c>, <c>mono-4.0</c>

properties.name: X86
properties.help: Run tests in a 32-bit process on 64-bit systems.

properties.name: DisposeRunners
properties.help: Dispose each test runner after it has finished running its tests

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Set timeout for each test case in milliseconds.

properties.name: Seed
properties.help: Set the random seed used to generate test cases.

properties.name: Workers
properties.help: Specify the number of worker threads to be used in running tests. This setting is used to control running your tests in parallel and is used in conjunction with the <c>Parallelizable</c> attribute. If not specified, workers defaults to the number of processors on the machine, or 2, whichever is greater.

properties.name: StopOnError
properties.help: Stop run immediately upon any test failure or error.

properties.name: SkipNonTestAssemblies
properties.help: Skip any non-test assemblies specified, without error.

properties.name: Debug
properties.help: Causes NUnit to break into the debugger immediately before it executes your tests. This is particularly useful when the tests are running in a separate process to which you would otherwise have to attach.

properties.name: DebugAgent
properties.help: Available only in debug builds of NUnit, this option is for use by developers in debugging the nunit-agent itself. It breaks in the agent code immediately upon entry of the process.

properties.name: Pause
properties.help: Causes NUnit to immediately open a message box, allowing you to attach a debugger. For cases where <c>--debug </c>does not work.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: Wait for input before closing console window.

properties.name: WorkPath
properties.help: Path of the directory to use for output files.

properties.name: OutputFile
properties.help: File path to contain text output from the tests.

properties.name: ErrorFile
properties.help: File path to contain error output from the tests.

properties.name: Results
properties.help: An output spec for saving the test results. This option may be repeated.

properties.name: Explores
properties.help: Display or save test info rather than running tests. Optionally provide an output spec for saving the test info. This option may be repeated.

properties.name: NoResults
properties.help: Don't save any test results.

properties.name: Labels
properties.help: Specify whether to write test case names to the output. Values: <c>Off</c>, <c>On</c>, <c>All</c>

properties.name: Trace
properties.help: Set internal trace level. Values: <c>Off</c>, !<c>Error</c>, <c>Warning</c>, <c>Info</c>, <c>Verbose</c> (<c>Debug</c>)

properties.name: Encoding
properties.help: Specify the console codepage, such as <c>utf-8</c>, <c>ascii</c>cc, etc. This option is not normally needed unless your output includes special characters. The page specified must be available on the system.

properties.name: ShadowCopy
properties.help: Tells .NET to copy loaded assemblies to the shadowcopy directory.

properties.name: TeamCity
properties.help: Turns on use of TeamCity service messages.

properties.name: LoadUserProfile
properties.help: Causes the user profile to be loaded in any separate test processes.

properties.name: ListExtensions
properties.help: Lists all extension points and the extensions installed on each of them.

properties.name: SetPrincipalPolicy
properties.help: Set the principal policy for the test domain. Values: <c>UnauthenticatedPrincipal</c>, <c>NoPrincipal</c>, <c>WindowsPrincipal</c>

properties.name: NoHeader
properties.help: Suppress display of program information at start of run.

properties.name: NoColor
properties.help: Displays console output without color.
